su_n_generalization.description: Killing form induces Euclidean metric on weight space for all SU(N)

conclusion.theorem_statement: For any SU(N), the Killing form induces a Euclidean metric on ℝ^{N-1}

gauge_group_comparison.description: What metrics do different gauge groups induce?

key_insight.theorem: Compact simple Lie groups ↔ Euclidean weight space metrics
key_insight.proof: Killing form is negative-definite for compact groups ⟹ induced metric is positive-definite
key_insight.converse: Non-compact groups have indefinite Killing forms ⟹ induced metrics are NOT Euclidean
key_insight.physical_selection: Only compact gauge groups are consistent with Euclidean spatial geometry

holonomy_verification.description: Verify flatness via holonomy group analysis

holonomy_analysis.parallel_transport: Path-independent (any vector returns unchanged around any loop)
holonomy_analysis.implication: Geometry is globally Euclidean, not just locally flat

weight_space.parallel_transport: Vector is unchanged around ANY loop

explicit_3d_metric.description: Full derivation of Euclidean metric from SU(3)

step_1_killing_metric_2d.interpretation: Metric on SU(3) weight space (Cartan dual)

step_2_angular_parametrization.polar_on_weight_space: (ρ, φ) where ρ² = w_3² + w_8², tan(φ) = w_8/w_3
step_2_angular_parametrization.note: The factor 1/12 can be absorbed into the radial scale

step_3_radial_from_qcd.radial_coordinate: r ∈ [0, ∞) dual to energy scale μ

step_4_combined_3d_metric.weight_space_embedding: Weight plane is at constant θ = π/2

step_6_isotropy.weyl_symmetry_preserved: S₃ ⊂ SO(3) acts by permuting colors

physical_predictions.description: Testable consequences of deriving Euclidean structure from SU(3)

prediction_1_isotropy.statement: Spatial isotropy follows from SU(3) Weyl symmetry S₃
prediction_1_isotropy.mechanism: Weyl group S₃ permutes colors → SO(3) rotations in physical space
prediction_1_isotropy.testable: Anisotropic QCD effects would violate this prediction

prediction_2_parity.statement: P (parity) is a valid symmetry in Euclidean space
prediction_2_parity.mechanism: Charge conjugation C in color space ↔ P in physical space
prediction_2_parity.connection: The stella octangula has two dual tetrahedra (P-related)
prediction_2_parity.testable: CPT theorem requires P to be well-defined
prediction_2_parity.experimental_status: P is a good symmetry of strong interactions (consistent ✓)

prediction_3_distance_quantization.statement: Characteristic distances are set by Λ_QCD and Killing metric

prediction_4_color_spatial_correspondenc.statement: Flux tube cross-section ~ weight triangle area
prediction_4_color_spatial_correspondenc.prediction: Flux tube geometry reflects SU(3) weight space geometry
prediction_4_color_spatial_correspondenc.testable: Lattice QCD simulations of flux tube cross-sections

prediction_5_string_tension.statement: String tension σ ~ Λ_QCD² from dimensional transmutation
prediction_5_string_tension.prediction: σ ~ 4 × Λ_QCD² (factor of 4 from geometric constants)

prediction_6_no_qcd_curvature.statement: QCD does not induce spatial curvature at large scales
prediction_6_no_qcd_curvature.mechanism: Killing metric is flat (R = 0) → physical space is locally Euclidean
prediction_6_no_qcd_curvature.testable: Any QCD-induced spatial curvature would violate flatness

medium_confidence_predictions: Flux tube geometry reflects weight space

visualization_data.description: Geometric data for visualizing SU(3) weight space

weyl_reflections.s_alpha1: Reflection through line perpendicular to α₁
weyl_reflections.s_alpha2: Reflection through line perpendicular to α₂
